thesis.description: From the position of oxygen in the periodic table its possibility as a tetravalent or hexavalent element is apparent and the constitutional formulae of a number of compounds in which oxygen occurs have been based on this fact, as for instance hydrogen peroxide. In the following paper, however, only compounds formed by the addition of halogens and halogen hydrides to organic substances containing oxygen are considered. Friedel found that hydrochloric acid and methyl ether when mixed in molecular proportion gave a liquid of the original composition boiling at a constant temperature. [...]

thesis.description: The development of the Phase Rule by Willard Gibbs has caused a considerable interest in the various hydrated salts and the phenomena attached to their solubilities, vapour pressures, etc. There is much information to hand with regard to such salts as calcium chloride and copper sulphate, but there is still a great deal to be learned with regard to nickel sulphate and its hydrates. For instance until quite recently the action of sunlight was supposed to decompose the normal hydrate into a lower one but this theory was refuted by Dobrosserdorf (J.Russ. Phys. Chem. thesis.description: Faraday, in 1825, published an account of his discovery of a gas in which the elements were in the same proportion as in olefiant gas, although they existed in a very different state of combination. thesis.description: The Province of Quebec, almost monopolizing as it does the output of maple products of the Dominion, may be said to be the centre of the maple syrup and sugar industry, with a result that the annual, value of the products from this source, amounts to a large sum. As maple sugar sand, an inevitable by-product of this industry, deemed of no particularvalue, and consequently discarded, was considered to contain malic acid, it was thought worthy of some study. Thus the present, investigations were commenced in the spring of 1911upon the recommendation of Dr. J.F. Snell, the object being to acquire some idea of the constituents of the material, with special regard to the content and isolation of malic acid. [...]

thesis.description: [...] DESCRIPTION. The Gray horizontal engine is of the 4 Cycle single acting type and has a single cylinder. It is fitted with a reciprocating fuel pump, which forces the gasoline into the ordinary type or jet carburettor. The pump action is determined by a shaft governor, which has a range of from 200 to 400 R.P.M's., but is very erratic at the lower speeds. When the speed rises above that for which the governor is set, the exhaust valve is held open, and the automatic inlet valve remains closed and by a system of levers, the pump is prevented from delivering its charge. [...]

thesis.description: Man is a suggestible animal" So says Dr. Sidis, so say I. This is most forcibly brought home to you, if you read a dozen articles on the same subject,and notice how your opinion, isswayed hither and thither like the branches of a tree in a wind storm. But let us go a step farther, and, in the light of experience, say,"Boy is a very suggestible animal." Granting the truth of this statement let us see what it is worth. We shall approach the problem of suggestion first on most familiar and commonplace ground, and, at the risk of being called a borrower, adopt Adams' method of searching the dictionary. Here we find suggestion defined as "a hint, a putting of something bofore the mind for consideration, anindirect mode of presenting argument or advice, usually intended to furnish us with some practical assistance." [...]
thesis.creator: Wilson, Alice M.
thesis.contributor: Dale, J. & Sinclair, S. & Hickson, J. (Supervisors)
thesis.subject: Education.
thesis.title: The educational significance of suggestion.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: During the summer of 1920 the writer was engaged in studying the bionomics of the Apple Sucker, Psyllia Mali, in Nova Scotia, and, having occasion to make numerous dissections, he was struck by the lack of literature dealing with the anatomy of any members of this family, particularly with regard to the internal organs. Investigation showed many interesting and unusual features in the morphology of the insect and so the entire anatomy was chosen as the subject for this thesis. The field is a wide one, and it has not been found possible to follow out all points in full detail in the time available, with only preserved material with which to work. If there appears to be a hesitancy and uncertainty in describing certain structures, it must be borne in mind that the body of this insect is only 2.5 m.m. long, so that the individual organs and sclerites are in most cases extremely minute, rendering the work of dissection very delicate and trying. The writer hopes to follow up those points which have only been lightly touched upon, extending the field of investigation to related species, with the object of producing a more complete and valuable piece of work.
thesis.creator: Saunders, Leslie G.
thesis.subject: Apple sucker -- Anatomy.
Entomology.
thesis.title: The anatomy of Psyllia mali, Schmidberger.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
